name: Unmanned Life
description: Unmanned life enables industries to be fully autonomous through its full stack AI for Autonomy software platform that deploys and manages coordinated and interoperable swarms / fleets of unmanned ground vehicles, aerial vehicles and other robotics systems through a single unified management interface, whether on-Premises, over-the-Cloud or on the Edge. Unmanned life’s vision is to deploy “Autonomy as a Service” (#AutonomyasaService) across different industry sectors: Autonomy-as-a-Service is the provisioning and management of on-demand, scalable, flexible and agile autonomous workforces, composed of swarms / fleets of different types of drones, robots and IoT devices working together seamlessly. The world’s first and only Autonomy-as-a-Service company, Unmanned Life’s platform can scale without limits in deploying large and flexible autonomous swarms of robots and drones and IoT over wifi, 4G and 5G to enable industry 4.0 use cases across industrial sectors such as autonomous logistics, autonomous public safety, and autonomous transport management, to name a few. This ground-breaking platform is now being used by the world’s top Telco and Supply Chain companies like Verizon, Deutsche Telekom, Telefonica, Swiss post and US and European logistics giants. Unmanned Life has already developed strategic partnerships with the likes of NVIDIA, US Telco Council, GSMA, IATA, Silicon Valley Bank, PwC, Telecom Infrastructure Project and others. Unmanned Life has generated an impressive 12.5x YoY growth, revenue acquisition of more than 600 K USD till date, and 2.5 M USD of funding from global marquee investors. Unmanned Life has achieved multiple world firsts in this short period with its key customers including the world’s first autonomous multi-drone swarm for emergency rescue with Verizon and Nokia (https://vimeo.com/300315201) and the world’s first fully autonomous sorting center with Swiss Post (https://vimeo.com/283651695), as well as the world’s first transatlantic autonomous drone flight over 5G with BT and Ericsson earlier this year (https://vimeo.com/289780893). Unmanned has received 6+ prestigious awards in the field of AI, Telco, Supply Chain, Deep Tech including the UK’s most Disruptive Innovation Award and National Technology Award and Postal Industry’s Sorting Center Innovation of the Year Award. Unmanned Life has impeccable references from the executive leadership of Verizon, Deutsche Telekom, Swiss Post and other notable figures. Unmanned Life’s 15+ highly skilled staff from over 9 nationalities have been educated at the world’s top schools in their respective disciplines and together have acquired more than 100 years of combined deep tech, management and business experience in some of the world’s leading companies in their respective domains before joining Unmanned Life to create a powerhouse team. Unmanned Life’s founders, as a result of their achievements, are appointed members of prestigious global organisations such as the World Economic Forum, European Union, The Telegraph, IATA, and their views have been published by New York Times, Bloomberg and tech giants like Microsoft. Unmanned Life has been featured by both CNN and BBC as industry leaders with ground-breaking technology and its founders have been invited to speak at major conferences around the world including South by South West, World Summit AI, Mobile World Congress, Websummit, South Summit and institutions like the European Parliament, European Commission and Stanford University. Unmanned Life was invited to debut Autonomy-as-a-Service at the World Economic Forum (WEF) 2019 as a pioneer of AI for Autonomy, which is seen by the WEF as a key enabler for Industry 4.0.

The insights we provide allow customers in multiple industries to track long-term trends, monitor change, and take guided, strategic actions to better serve their customers. In 2022, UrtheCast plans to launch UrtheDaily, the world’s first earth observation system designed from the ground-up to produce scientific-quality, analytics-ready imagery of the entire earth's landmass every day. Early in 2019, UrtheCast acquired Geosys – bringing more than 30 years of experience in agricultural analysis of satellite and weather data. The team’s global geo-information services range from crops monitoring and benchmarking for risk management, to precision farming and grain marketing support. name: Venafi
description: Criminals want to gain trusted status and go undetected. This makes keys and certificates a prime target, which are blindly trusted by most of today’s Global 5000 enterprises. Criminals steal and compromise keys and certificates that are not properly protected, and use them to circumvent security controls—to hide in encrypted traffic, deploy malware, and steal data. these uniquely identify webservers, software, mobile devices, apps, admins, and even airplanes This has become the attack of choice. Current security controls are being undermined. Compromised SSL/TLS, SSH and mobile certificates and keys undermine data loss prevention, next-gen firewalls, strong authentication, sandboxing and other security systems. Attackers 1) mask their true identity using keys and certificates and 2) hide their actions by encrypting data which means you can’t look inside for threats. Protecting keys and certificates eliminates both of these blind spots and makes all security systems stronger. Venafi finds all keys and certificates and puts them under surveillance to detect anomalies, and learns and adapts as it works. Venafi identifies what keys and certificates are trusted and those that need to be replaced. It keeps keys and certificates secured to your policy and replaces them automatically. From stopping certificate-based outages to enabling SSL inspection, Venafi creates an ever-evolving, intelligent response that protects your network, your business, and your brand.

The company serves Fortune-500 enterprises and carriers in retail, energy, healthcare, technology, financial services, manufacturing, and transportation industries. Viptela, Inc. was incorporated in 2012 and is based in San Jose, California. As of July 31, 2017, Viptela, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Cisco Systems, Inc.

name: Woo Doo
description: Woodoo is reinventing wood, to make it the most efficient building material of the 21st century. Ubiquitous in everyday objects and in human homes for millennia, wood is an essential material, a familiar symbol of the symbiosis between man and nature. But it has many limitations: in addition to being vulnerable to fire and insect attack, it has limited structural strength and complete opacity that limits its scope of use. Woodoo removes all these limitations by reconstructing the internal structure of the wood at the molecular level. Wood is indeed a porous matrix of cellulose and binding elements (lignin, hemicellulose, etc.) that can contain 50 to 90% of air depending on the species of wood. Thanks to an innovative and patented process, Woodoo manages to release the internal matrix of the wood while reinforcing it with natural compounds that have the property of creating much stronger anatomical bonds between the native fibers of the wood. Due to its exceptional properties, this hybrid wood material opens up entirely new possibilities in the field of design and construction. The production of translucent wood will also contribute to the revitalization of the wood industry in France. Translucent wood, a unique material born of a patented innovation, has four essential qualities that give it comparative advantages: * a unique aesthetic appearance. * high structural performance. * exceptional ecological performance. * a low production cost.

Since its commercial launch in June 2010, Xenex devices are now included in infection control protocols in almost three hundred hospitals throughout the U.S. Traditional UV disinfection methodologies primarily achieve one type of cellular damage. Pulsed Xenon Full Spectrum™ UV disinfection Robots leverage the full germicidal UV spectrum, achieving four primary methods of cellular damage. The Xenex Germ-Zapping Robot™ contains NO TOXIC MERCURY. Xenex is the only UV disinfection provider with multiple hospital customers reporting fewer infections in peer-reviewed published studies. Designed as the single source of truth for managing the modern workforce, Zenefits delivers the most complete, all-mobile HR experience by tightly integrating its own powerful applications with dozens of best-of-breed providers on the Zenefits platform. Zenefits’ applications like HR, Benefits, Time, Payroll and Compliance combine with partner applications like email, collaboration, expense management, and employee engagement to create a powerful platform. Thousands of businesses use Zenefits to empower their employees, manage change and stay compliant. http://www.zenefits.com

name: Zepteon
description: Zepteon, Inc. develops chromatography resins for separating antibodies with specific sugar structures (nonfucosylated) that are potent against diseases like cancer. It offers Glycap-3A, a resin to make a biosimilar antibody with a nonfucose level that matches that of the original drug. The company was founded in 2012 and is based in Boston, Massachusetts.

name: ZeroFOX
description: ZeroFOX operates as a social cyber security intelligence, analytics, and protection company that provides real-time social threat analytics, intelligence, and advanced security protection via its cloud-based cyber platform. Its ZeroFOX intelligence Livefeed, Protection Cloud, and Social Monitoring cloud products enable proactive defense by–integrating into perimeter security solutions; stopping malware and targeted attacks via a distributed filtering cloud infrastructure; and protecting organization executives from fraud and social engineering attacks. The company also provides ZeroFOX Employee Protection and Executive & VIP Protection to safeguard high-value employees from targeted threats, such as impersonation, fraud, scams, physical threats, and reputational damage. In addition, it offers Anomali, ThreatConnect, and ThreatQuotient that enable customers to prevent, detect, respond to, and recover from social media-based threats; and ZeroFOX OnWatch, a managed monitoring and protection service designed to help companies better safeguard themselves against threats plaguing a range of platforms, including social media and digital platforms, surface web, and web and mobile app stores. ZeroFOX was formerly known as Riskive, Inc. and changed its name to ZeroFOX in November 2013. The company was incorporated in 2013 and is based in Baltimore, Maryland.
industry_label: Hardware & IT equipment | Software & internet services

name: Zerotech
description: Founded in 2007 and headquartered in China, ZEROTECH is a provider of smart drones and smart UAVs, with expertise in UAV technologies such as flight controller, gimbals, HD video transmission, CV, binocular, and electronic image stabilization. Committed to its guiding principle, “BE SMART BE INNOVATIVE”, ZEROTECH develops cutting-edge smart drone and smart UAV technologies. With almost a decade of experience in fixed-wing and multi-rotor smart drones and smart UAVs, ZEROTECH has a track record of developing civil use UAVs. Since the launch of its very first product, the Blue Eagle fixed-wing drone, it has developed flight control systems, stabilizing gimbals and expanded into multi-rotor drones for commercial and professional use. ZEROTECH has developed technologies and supplied drones for mapping, security, filming, agriculture, inspection of power lines and scientific research. Its ‘GEMINI’ autopilot system is renowned internationally. Since 2015, in addition to maintaining its commercial market leadership, ZEROTECH has deepened its efforts in developing products for the consumer market. Partnering closely with international chip maker Qualcomm, ZEROTECH has made remarkable breakthroughs in smart drone technologies. In 2016, it launched pocket-size selfie drone DOBBY, enabling consumers to enjoy pocket-size tech that makes flying fun and easy.

name: Zimmer Biomet Holdings
description: Zimmer, Inc., doing business as Zimmer Biomet, designs, manufactures, and markets joint replacement surgical implants to healthcare industry. It offers knee, hip, and shoulder replacement products; elbow and trauma products; foot and ankle systems; biologics and sports medicine solutions; surgical and operating room solutions that include tourniquets and power equipment with interchangeable blades and more; spine solutions; and dental implant products. In addition, the company provides surgical techniques to medical professionals and support services. Its solutions support orthopedic surgeons and clinicians to restore mobility, and treat arthritis and traumatic injuries. The company offers products through its sales associates in the United States and internationally. The company was founded in 1927 and is based in Warsaw, Indiana with manufacturing facilities in Ponce, Puerto Rico; Winterthur, Switzerland; northern New Jersey; Dover, Ohio; and Shannon, Ireland and biologics research facility in Austin, Texas; and locations in Minneapolis, Minnesota as well as Carlsbad, California. Zimmer, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc.

name: Zintro
description: Zintro, Inc. operates a global platform that enables companies to start a conversation with highly specialized experts, consultants, contractors, and job candidates about potential phone consults, projects, or employment opportunities. It offers Zintro that enables users to submit a project, job, or inquiry. The company’s Zintro helps various experts to promote their services and source new business, such as consultants, CXO and VP, entrepreneurs and startups, lawyers, market researchers and CI, institutional investors, procurement, engineers and scientists, recruiters, journalists, physicians and healthcare providers, industry experts, SMEs, KOLs, sales and business development, and job seekers. Its users range from Global 1000 companies to individual entrepreneurs. Zintro, Inc. was incorporated in 2007 and is based in Waltham, Massachusetts.

name: Zocdoc
description: Zocdoc is the tech company at the beginning of a better healthcare experience. Each month, millions of patients use Zocdoc to find in-network neighborhood doctors they love, instantly book appointments online, see what other real patients have to say, get reminders for upcoming appointments and preventive check-ups, fill out their paperwork online and more. With a mission to give power to the patient, Zocdoc’s online marketplace delivers the accessible, seamless and simple experience patients expect and deserve.

description: Zoom Video Communications is a company headquartered in San Jose, California that provides remote conferencing services using cloud computing.

name: ZoomInfo
description: ZoomInfo provides access to more direct dials and email addresses than any other B2B contact provider. Verified professional and business profiles come fully loaded with detailed information about prospects, including web mentions, employment history, and direct access to colleagues, people can engage ideal buyer personas and accounts in a more meaningful way. ZoomInfo uses its diverse portfolio of proprietary technology, a community of 300,000+ users, and third-party integrations to collect, organize, validate, and publish a comprehensive directory of business data in the marketplace. ZoomInfo's mission is to provide every company with a 360-degree view of their ideal customer, empowering each phase of their go-to-market strategy, and driving their ability to hit their number. ZoomInfo was founded in 2000 and is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.

name: ZTE USA
description: ZTE USA, Inc. provides telecommunications equipment and network solutions in the United States. It offers wireless communications systems, wireline switch and access equipment, optical and data communications equipment, handsets, and telecommunications software systems and services. The company also provides Ethernet Passive Optical Network solution that allows multiple system operators to deploy optical distribution network architectures for residential, commercial, and mobile backhaul applications; and remote control switch systems, multi-media communications systems, and communications transmission systems; computer software and digital equipment; integrated circuit products; and electronic components. In addition, it offers technical design, development, consultation, and related services for the research and manufacture of mobile communications systems equipment, satellite communications, microwave communications equipment, beepers, computer hardware and software, closed-circuit televisions, automated signal control, computer information processing, process monitoring systems, and fire alarm systems, as well as 3G mobile hotspot. Further, the company provides technical design, development, consultation, and related services for wireline and wireless communications projects of railways, mass transit railways, urban rail transit, highways, plants and mines, ports and terminals, and airports; and construction and operation of telecommunications networks. Furthermore, it purchases and sells electronic devices and micro-electronic components; sub-contracts communications and related projects; and engages in the technical development and sale of electronics systems equipment. ZTE USA, Inc. was founded in 1998 and is based in Richardson, Texas. The company has offices in Iselin, New Jersey; Chicago, Illinois; and San Diego, California. ZTE USA, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of ZTE Corporation.

name: Zume Inc
description: Zume is on a quest to be the most powerful source of health and well-being on the planet. They started by partnering people with technology to create a more thoughtful and efficient way to source, make, bake and deliver pizza. In the process, they are delivering an artisan pizza that takes care of the people who eat it and make it, and even takes better care of the planet we all love—a planet nearly 10 billion people will inhabit by 2050. The health and well-being of people and our planet is dependent upon sustainably feeding that population with wholesome, affordable food on a global scale. Zume is meeting this challenge with an end-to-end, scalable platform that reduces the time and distance between clean food sources and dense population centers, using cutting-edge automation and transportation logistics. By developing better tools and processes, they can feed people healthier, sustainably-grown food, delivered fresh and free from chemical stabilization.

name: Zume Pizza
description: Zume Pizza operates as a pizza delivery platform based in Mountain View, CA. Zume has established a formula for partnering people with technology that creates a more thoughtful and efficient way to source, make, bake, and deliver pizza. The company was founded in 2015.

name: Zumper
description: Zumper is making renting an apartment as easy as booking a hotel. We’re building the first-ever search-through-close rental platform where a renter can search, schedule a tour, or instantly apply all through their phone. With over 50 million annual users across our two brands Zumper & PadMapper, we’ve generated support from top-tier investors and have raised $90 million to date.

name: Zynga
description: Zynga develops, markets, and operates social games as live services played on the Internet, social networking sites, and mobile platforms in the United States and internationally. It offers its online social games primarily under the Slots, Words With Friends, Zynga Poker, and FarmVille franchises. The company’s games are accessible on mobile platforms, Facebook, and other social networks. It also provides advertising services to advertising agencies and brokers. Zynga was established in 2007 and is headquartered in San Francisco, California.
